title: TextBundle
description: A TextBundle is a directory containing a text file and its associated assets.

version.description: The version number of the file format. Latest version is 2.

type.description: The UTI of the `text.*` file. E.g. set to `net.daringfireball.markdown` for Markdown. This field should default to `net.daringfireball.markdown` to be backwards-compatible with version 1.

transient.description: Whether or not the bundle is a temporary container solely used for exchanging a document between applications. See section “Cooperating With Other Applications”. Defaults to “false”.

creatorURL.description: The URL of the application that originally created the TextBundle. Can be used by viewers to switch back to the originating editor.

creatorIdentifier.description: The bundle identifier of the application that created the file.

sourceURL.description: The URL of the file used to generate the TextBundle. Can be used to switch back to a source file within the originating editor app.

^.*[.].*$.description: Application-specific information can be stored inside a nested dictionary, referenced by a key using the application bundle identifier (e.g. `com.example.myapp`).

version.description: The version number of the application-specific data.
